main event: An observer sighted a bright orange object hovering above the Nome-Teller road in Alaska on September 7, 1967, for about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as moving up and down and hovering, emitting light from its sides and top., The object was initially thought to be an airplane but it was determined to be something else., Other witnesses corroborated the sighting, including a teacher and others driving on the road., The object eventually disappeared behind the hills., The observer noted that the object resembled a 'ball of fire'.
witness description: A female teacher and other civilians who were driving in the area.
